column4: hm but when these people add new content to their website (which they do using frontpage ><), the umlauts are gonna be wrong again i guess. telling apache the format sounds better
pal says he can't get apache to read the .htaccess or something like that, and has to use vhosts (????????)
what can possibly go wrong that apache doesn't read the htaccess?
incorrect permission, AccessFileName not configured, AllowOverride not set
